item.title: Fortnite Announces $2.5m Reload Elite Series With Finals At Esports World Cup
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite has unveiled the Reload Elite Series with a mammoth $2.5m prize pool, and the finals are set to take place in next year’s Esports World Cup in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

Open to all players who meet the requirements, which include being ranked at Elite level or higher in Reload Ranked, players across the world will compete for $1.5m during the qualifying stage, with an additional $1m to be distributed at the Esports World Cup.

Fortnite Reload Elite Series Prize Pool & Schedule Revealed

Each qualifier will begin with two Opens, each having up to 12 matches per Open, with the top 2,000 in EU, top 1,000 in NAC, and top 500 in OCE/ASIA/ME/BR/NAW advancing to the Play-Ins.

At the Play-In stage, the top 80 Duos advance to the Heats, and the top five Duos from each Heat advance to the finals. There, 20 Duos face off across eight matches to secure a spot onstage at the Esports World Cup in Riyadh.

To compete in a Qualifier, players must be ranked Elite or above in Reload, have an Account Level of at least 250, and have participated in 14 tournaments within the past 180 days of the Qualifier. Full eligibility details are available on the Fortnite website.

The first Open in the Qualifiers kicks off on January 8, with the first final on February 8, with three additional rounds of qualifying taking place until June, with June 28 the final date for Duos to secure a spot at the Esports World Cup.

The 2026 Esports World Cup kicks off on July 6, running until August 23, with titles including Apex Legends, Call of Duty: Warzone, EA FC 26, League of Legends, and Overwatch 2 participating.

How impressed are you by the Esports scene in Fortnite? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, find out all the details of Winterfest 2025, and check out where to find Bigfoot in Fortnite.

item.title: PlayStation 5 Was US’s Best-Selling Hardware in November 2025
item.content:encoded:
The latest United States (US) video game hardware sales data for November 2025 has revealed that PlayStation 5 was the best-selling hardware, surpassing the Nintendo Switch 2.

The latest video game sales data comes from Circana, which states that monthly hardware spending has fallen 27% year over year to $695 million. This makes November 2025 the worst month for hardware spending since the $455 million in November 2005.

PlayStation 5 Overtakes Nintendo Switch 2 in Hardware Sales for November 2025

Coming to the actual units, 1.6 million video game hardware units were sold across all platforms in the US, the lowest for a November since 1995, when 1.4 million units were sold. Surprisingly, the PlayStation 5 was the best-selling hardware in both units and dollars, and this is the first time it has topped the charts since the Nintendo Switch 2 was released. Nintendo’s latest console came in second for both units and dollars.

The third-best-selling console for November 2025 was split between NEX Playground and the Xbox Series consoles. NEX Playground ranked third in units sold this month, whereas Xbox Series ranked third in dollars. NEX Playground coming in third is not a big surprise, considering it toppled the PS5 Slim Digital Sales in the United States midway through November.

In other news, Battlefield 6 is 2025’s best-selling game in the United States, year-to-date. Additionally, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 was the US’s best-selling game of November 2025. What are your thoughts on PlayStation 5 becoming the best-selling hardware of November 2025? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Dispatch Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 release date being revealed through the eShop listing. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
